input: Analyze a new market's entry potential by gathering data from multiple sources, synthesizing insights to address uncertainties, and producing a structured market entry strategy report.

inputs.name: M
inputs.input_data: Historical market size (USD), CAGR, regional segmentation

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Competitor revenue, product offerings, market share

inputs.name: R
inputs.input_data: Tariff rates, licensing requirements, foreign ownership limits

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Survey responses on product preferences, pricing sensitivity
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: I
inputs.input_data: Maximum allowable CAPEX for market entry
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: M
inputs.source_origin: Synthesis of Competitor Portfolio Data (2) and Regulatory Restrictions (3)

inputs.name: C
inputs.source_origin: Clustering analysis on Customer Preference Dataset (4)

outputs: Automated email + calendar invite for strategy review meeting
steps:
Uses: Market Size & Growth Data (1)  
Action: Clean and normalize time-series market data  
Produces: Normalized Market Dataset  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)

Uses: Competitor Portfolio Data (2), Regulatory Restrictions (3)  
Action: Calculate market concentration ratio (HHI) + regulatory friction index  
Produces: Market Barrier Scorecard  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)

Uses: Customer Preference Dataset (4)  
Action: Apply k-means clustering to identify 3–5 customer segments  
Produces: Customer Segmentation Model (8)  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)

Uses: Investment Budget Threshold (5), Internal Financial System Access (6)  
Action: Compare budget against historical ROI benchmarks  
Produces: Financial Viability Assessment  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)

Uses: Market Barrier Scorecard (Step 2 output), Customer Segmentation Model (8), Financial Viability Assessment (Step 4 output)  
Action: Synthesize inputs into weighted decision matrix  
Produces: Strategic Insight Matrix  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)

Uses: Strategic Insight Matrix (Step 5 output)  
Action: Generate structured report using pre-defined template logic  
Produces: Structured Market Entry Strategy Report  
Stores/Sends To: Document management system (SharePoint://strategy-reports/)

Uses: Structured Market Entry Strategy Report (Step 6 output)  
Action: Trigger board approval workflow via Microsoft Power Automate  
Produces: Triggered Action: Board Approval Workflow  
Stores/Sends To: Microsoft Teams channel #executive-strategy
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:  
1. Market Size & Growth Data  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Statista/World Bank API  
   Input Data: Historical market size (USD), CAGR, regional segmentation  
   Bound Reference: None  

2. Competitor Portfolio Data  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Crunchbase API  
   Input Data: Competitor revenue, product offerings, market share  
   Bound Reference: None  

3. Regulatory Restrictions  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Government open-data portal (e.g., trade.gov)  
   Input Data: Tariff rates, licensing requirements, foreign ownership limits  
   Bound Reference: None  

4. Customer Preference Dataset  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Internal survey results (CSV upload)  
   Input Data: Survey responses on product preferences, pricing sensitivity  
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

5. Investment Budget Threshold  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Strategic planning team  
   Input Data: Maximum allowable CAPEX for market entry  
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

6. Internal Financial System Access  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: SAP ERP system  
   Input Data: Historical ROI benchmarks, cost structures  
   Bound Reference: None  

7. Market Entry Barriers (DERIVABLE)  
   Source Type: DERIVABLE  
   Source Origin: Synthesis of Competitor Portfolio Data (2) and Regulatory Restrictions (3)  
   Input Data: Weighted barrier score (regulatory + competitive friction)  
   Bound Reference: Inputs 2, 3  
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

8. Customer Segmentation Model (DERIVABLE)  
   Source Type: DERIVABLE  
   Source Origin: Clustering analysis on Customer Preference Dataset (4)  
   Input Data: Segmented personas with preference clusters  
   Bound Reference: Input 4  
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

Outputs:  
1. Structured Market Entry Strategy Report (PDF/DOCX)  
   - Market attractiveness score  
   - Risk mitigation roadmap  
   - Recommended entry mode (e.g., JV, acquisition)  

2. Anonymized Market Data Warehouse Snapshot  
   - Aggregated datasets from Inputs 1–6, 7–8  

3. Triggered Action: Board Approval Workflow  
   - Automated email + calendar invite for strategy review meeting  

Steps:  
Step 1:  
Uses: Market Size & Growth Data (1)  
Action: Clean and normalize time-series market data  
Produces: Normalized Market Dataset  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)  

Step 2:  
Uses: Competitor Portfolio Data (2), Regulatory Restrictions (3)  
Action: Calculate market concentration ratio (HHI) + regulatory friction index  
Produces: Market Barrier Scorecard  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)  

Step 3:  
Uses: Customer Preference Dataset (4)  
Action: Apply k-means clustering to identify 3–5 customer segments  
Produces: Customer Segmentation Model (8)  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)  

Step 4:  
Uses: Investment Budget Threshold (5), Internal Financial System Access (6)  
Action: Compare budget against historical ROI benchmarks  
Produces: Financial Viability Assessment  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)  

Step 5:  
Uses: Market Barrier Scorecard (Step 2 output), Customer Segmentation Model (8), Financial Viability Assessment (Step 4 output)  
Action: Synthesize inputs into weighted decision matrix  
Produces: Strategic Insight Matrix  
Stores/Sends To: Internal data lake (AWS S3://market-entry/)  

Step 6:  
Uses: Strategic Insight Matrix (Step 5 output)  
Action: Generate structured report using pre-defined template logic  
Produces: Structured Market Entry Strategy Report  
Stores/Sends To: Document management system (SharePoint://strategy-reports/)  

Step 7:  
Uses: Structured Market Entry Strategy Report (Step 6 output)  
Action: Trigger board approval workflow via Microsoft Power Automate  
Produces: Triggered Action: Board Approval Workflow  
Stores/Sends To: Microsoft Teams channel #executive-strategy  

Dependency Consistency Check:  
- All inputs used in at least one step  
- No undeclared inputs in steps  
- USER-CONTROLLED inputs (4,5) explicitly identified  
- SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE inputs (1,2,3,6) tied to endpoints  
- DERIVABLE inputs (7,8) fully decomposed to leaf nodes
